titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Cornwall Schools Collection 1833-1990 (Bulk 1833-1940) MS 031 MS 031 MS 031
titlestmt.author: Processed by Ryan Bachman

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-08-19 01:51:07 -0700.

did.abstract: This collection is devoted to Cornwall’s educational history.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: This collection was begun by Cornwall historian E.C. Starr and added onto by subsequent town historians and presidents of the Cornwall Historical Society.

archdesc.userestrict:
Use Restrictions Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
Research library
Cornwall Historical Society
7 Pine Street
PO Box 115
Cornwall, CT 06753
Phone: 860-672-0505
E-mail: CornHistSoc@optonline.net

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); The Cornwall Schools Collection; MS 031; box number; folder number; Cornwall Historical Society

bioghist.head: Historical/Biographical Note
bioghist.p: At its peak, Cornwall was divided into seventeen school districts, each with its own schoolhouse. However, as the town’s population began to decline after the mid-nineteenth century, these schools closed and were eventually consolidated into the Cornwall Consolidated School in 1940. This collection contains information on all but four of Cornwall’s former school districts, as well as on general state educational requirements, various private schools that existed at one time in the community, and colleges attended by town residents. The majority of materials are related to the Second School District, which encompassed the area around Cornwall Plain.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection includes eight archival boxes which are devoted to district schools, private schools, universities, and general information, respectively. The exception to this ordering is the Second School District, which has two archival boxes devoted to its materials. Each of these boxes are subdivided into sections, which are arranged in chronological order, or alphabetically by teacher’s last name.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Folders are arranged alphabetically or chonologically by topic.
The files are grouped into 4 series:

list.item: State Educational Information and District Schools
Private Schools and Cornwal Public Schools
